com.example.tasktracker
Class FulfillTask

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      com.example.tasktracker.FulfillTask

public class FulfillTask
extends Activity

This class is an activity which allows the user to perform the actions requested by a task author.

  • Text Response
  • Photo (from memory or on the fly)
  • Audio (from memory or on the fly)

Author:
zturchan

Method Detail

onCreate

public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
When the activity is created, initialize appropriate UI components and connect the appropriate listeners. We also set the text of the information TextViews to reflect that information entered by the author to describe the task (name, description, responses, scope)

onCreateOptionsMenu

public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)

takePhoto

public void takePhoto(View view)
When the user clicks on the "Take Photo" Button, initiate the photo taker activity and pass it the task we're working on and the arrayList of photos we are working with

Parameters:
view -

recordAudio

public void recordAudio(View view)
When implemented, when the user clicks on the "Record Audio" button they will see a new activity which will let them record using the android device's microphone.

Parameters:
view -

findPhoto

public void findPhoto(View view)
When implemented, will allow the user to select a photo from the phone's storage for use in a fulfillment

findAudio

public void findAudio(View view)
When implemented, will allow the user to select an audio file from the phone's storage for use in a fulfillment

cancelFulfill

public void cancelFulfill(View view)

saveFulfill

public void saveFulfill(View view)
When the user has fulfilled the requirements of the task (perhaps more) the system will check to see that the submission is acceptable. The validity check is to be implemented, but assuming the fulfillment is valid this method will create a new fulfillment object and attach it to the correct task via the taskmanager

Parameters:
view -
